@danlysiak improved the logic to extract the case type ID. Now is basically no longer in the code, but it's in the 2 new config properties I've introduced. Those 2 properties tell where the case type id is in the index name, by using regex groups.
Let me know if it's better now

timeline.author: danlysiak

replies.bodyText:
Also - we are currently (and with my suggestion too) getting the index name from the first hit. If a service passes an ES query with "size": 0 then there won't be any hits but it can still have a total - do we always expect/are we telling services that they should always pass a size for these kinds of queries but _source = false?
Sorry if repeating things that have already been covered! I can see we'll be using _source = false in the ticket for the original business scenario, but may need to document in known limitations so services know too?
replies.author: danlysiak

replies.bodyText: mmm, This is a nice  one.    May be response.searchResult.getFirstHit(SearchResult.Hit.class); will be better. As we only need  to get  1) the index 2) the size and also expect empty results . Hence its is better not force a conversion to ElasticSearchCaseDetailsDTO to evaluate attributes  from hits only.      I can test it tomorrow.  I looks possible.   Hopefully it does not break our test . As far I am remember not all our elastic  test mocks does have hits-->hits--> _source structure

I think this logic (once corrected) could be better placed inside the elasticsearchRequest.hasSource() method. And rename that method to something more suitable, perhaps
